author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
Of potent potions forged for health,
Weight's burden eased by stealthy form,
The needle's sting no more required,
Ozempic's new visage adorned.

Between two mighty dragons' wrath,
The seafarers in peril's grasp,
Seek to silo their hoards of gold,
Lest the storms of war-tide surpass.

In the realm of bonds and seithes,
Rise the sales of risky pledges,
Firms submit to harsher bindings,
Navigating tempest's ledges.

feedItems.title: Pill Versions of Ozempic-Like Drugs Are Coming
feedItems.description: Tablets could appeal to people who want to lose weight but despise needles, which injections like Ozempic require.

feedItems.title: Companies Try New Strategy to Stay in China: Siloing
feedItems.description: As tensions rise between Washington and Beijing, firms are seeking ways to wall off China businesses in case relations worsen.

feedItems.title: Junk-Bond Sales Are Up as Firms Submit to Tougher Terms
feedItems.description: Low-rated companies are finding ways to tap bond markets while minimizing the hit to their borrowing costs.

author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
Oh sea, thy song doth resound
With whispers of Titan's fate, profound,
Built in secret for wary tongues,
To follow deep submar'd songs.

Alas, the humble bond is raised
By firms, 'pon tougher terms be praised,
Low-rated, quenching cup's embrace,
Their debt's burden to softly grace.

From Russia's chaos, dreams unsettled,
In China's breast, uncertainty dappled,
Woe, the partner against the West,
Finds Ukraine's strife, a woeful test.

feedItems.title: The Ultra-Secret Underwater Spy System That Might Have Heard the Titan Implode
feedItems.description: The system of undersea microphones fixed to the sea floor was originally built to track Soviet submarines.

feedItems.title: Junk-Bond Sales Are Up as Firms Submit to Tougher Terms
feedItems.description: Low-rated companies are finding ways to tap bond markets while minimizing the hit to their borrowing costs.

feedItems.title: Russia Disarray Creates a Moment of Uncertainty in China
feedItems.description: Fast-moving developments in Russia have made real Beijing’s worry the Ukraine invasion would destabilize its partner against the West.

author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
In Wagner's march on Moscow's might,
A compromise hath brought us light;
A war averted by God's hand,
Belarus hath stayed their plan.

Brother Lukashenko strong,
In peace and strife, he doth belong;
He brokers deal 'twixt Putin's might,
And rebels seeking endless fight.

But now, in Moscow's court and town,
Ukraine's war turns thrones around;
The fate of kingdoms hangs in wake,
As Putin's power starts to shake.

feedItems.title: Wagner Stops March on Moscow as Belarus Brokers Deal
feedItems.description: The compromise between the paramilitary group and Russian President Vladimir Putin averted an armed confrontation that threatened to plunge the country into civil war.

feedItems.title: Wagner Stops March on Moscow as Belarus Brokers Deal
feedItems.description: Belarus President Alexander Lukashenko brokered a deal between Russian President Vladimir Putin and the rebels, averting an armed confrontation that threatened to plunge the country into civil war.

feedItems.title: More »
feedItems.description: Putin's war in Ukraine was meant to achieve regime change in Kyiv. Now it is threatening the regime in Moscow.

author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
Upon thicketed ways of Wagner's kin,
In Rus' heart where strife dost hold its sway,
Yevgeny, bold, his forces reins to win,
And halt descent in civil war's display.

Where waters of Yellowstone do flow,
Lo, bridge asunder, train cars slip beneath,
Of asphalt, sulfur laden, whispers grow,
One drinks those tides with heed in times of wreath.

Far o'er the lands, the West doth cast a stance,
Keen not to court Wagner-Kremlin strife,
With balance sought, no sides in thorny dance,
Avoiding meddling in this ill strife.

feedItems.title: What's Happening With Wagner in Russia?
feedItems.description: Wagner chief Yevgeny Prigozhin has pulled his forces back from the brink of a bloody clash with the Russian army in Moscow that threatened to plunge the country into civil war.

feedItems.title: Train Cars Fall Into Yellowstone River in Montana After Bridge Collapse
feedItems.description: Several of the freight cars were carrying asphalt and sulfur, prompting water-use warnings.

feedItems.title: U.S., Allies Keen Not to Take Sides in Wagner-Kremlin Clash
feedItems.description: Western states intend to avoid moves that suggest involvement in the dispute.
